info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 5:57AM EDT until June 22 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton NY
info.description:
FFWBGM
The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Chenango County in central New York... Northwestern Delaware County in central New York... Southwestern Otsego County in central New York...
* Until 900 AM EDT.
* At 557 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oneonta, Norwich, Guilford, Maryland, Otego, Morris, Milford, Gilbertsville, Laurens, West End, Mt Upton, Rockdale, Emmons, Colliersville, Cooperstown Junction, New Lisbon, Preston, South New Berlin, Wells Bridge and Gilbert Lake State Park.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

area.areaDesc: Chenango, NY; Delaware, NY; Otsego, NY
